heading: measurement UID
comment: A unique identifier for the set of measurements, generated by concatenating the identifier given to the manuscript with which the measurements are associated with a count of how many layout or extent elements precede the current element in the entry file.

heading: file URL
comment: A unique identifier for the catalogue file, given in the xml:id attribute to the TEI root element.

heading: collection
comment: The collection in which the manuscript is recorded, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "collection" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: ms ID
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "msID" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: shelfmark
comment: The shelfmark given to the manuscript, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "shelfmark" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: ms type
comment: Whether the current row concerns a fragment ('fragment'), a manuscript part ('part'), an entire manuscript ('manuscript'), a manuscript containing parts ('manuscript-composite') or a manuscript containing fragments ('manuscript-with-fragment').

heading: part name
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript or manuscript part in an idno element which has @type "part" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: part ID
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript or manuscript part in an xml:id attribute. If the current row is not for a fragment or a manuscript part, this column will be the same as the metadata: ID column.

heading: extent
comment: Details of the layout section's extent, usually in folios. Note that the format in which this information is presented can vary, but the usual format is for counts of post-medieval endleaves to be given in Roman numerals, and counts of medieval leaves to be given in Arabic numerals.

heading: n folios
comment: An integer count of the number of folios contained within the core of the layout section, that is not counting contemporary or later endleaves.

heading: n endleaves
comment: An integer count of the number of endleaves attached to the layout section which are believed to be contemporary with its original production.

heading: n later endleaves
comment: An integer count of the number of endleaves attached to the layout section which are believed to date to a different time to its original production.

heading: height
xpath: for $m in (//tei:extent[not(ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:layout)] | //tei:layout) return normalize-space(string-join(if (string-length(string-join((($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]] | $m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/(tei:height[@quantity]/@quantity | tei:height[not(@quantity)])), " ")) > 0) then (string-join((($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]] | $m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/(tei:height[@quantity]/@quantity | tei:height[not(@quantity)]), distinct-values(($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]] | $m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/@unit)), " ")) else (), " "))
comment: The height of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a roll, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "roll", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: height max
xpath: for $m in (//tei:extent[not(ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:layout)] | //tei:layout) return normalize-space(string-join(for $dim in ($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]]|$m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/(tei:height/@max|tei:height[@quantity]/@quantity|tei:height[not(@quantity)])[last()] return if (not(number($dim) = number($dim))) then string($dim) else if ($dim/ancestor::tei:dimensions/@unit = 'in') then round(number($dim) * 25.4) else string($dim), " "))
comment: The maximum height of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a roll, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "roll", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: height min
xpath: for $m in (//tei:extent[not(ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:layout)] | //tei:layout) return normalize-space(string-join(for $dim in ($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]]|$m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/(tei:height/@min|tei:height[@quantity]/@quantity|tei:height[not(@quantity)])[last()] return if (not(number($dim) = number($dim))) then string($dim) else if ($dim/ancestor::tei:dimensions/@unit = 'in') then round(number($dim) * 25.4) else string($dim), " "))
comment: The minimum height of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a roll, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "roll", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no minimum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width
xpath: for $m in (//tei:extent[not(ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:layout)] | //tei:layout) return normalize-space(string-join(if (string-length(string-join((($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]] | $m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/(tei:width[@quantity]/@quantity | tei:width[not(@quantity)])), " ")) > 0) then (string-join((($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]] | $m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/(tei:width[@quantity]/@quantity | tei:width[not(@quantity)]), distinct-values(($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]] | $m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/@unit)), " ")) else (), " "))
comment: The width of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a roll, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "roll", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width max
xpath: for $m in (//tei:extent[not(ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:layout)] | //tei:layout) return normalize-space(string-join(for $dim in ($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]]|$m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/(tei:width/@max|tei:width[@quantity]/@quantity|tei:width[not(@quantity)])[last()] return if (not(number($dim) = number($dim))) then string($dim) else if ($dim/ancestor::tei:dimensions/@unit = 'in') then round(number($dim) * 25.4) else string($dim), " "))
comment: The maximum width of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a roll, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "roll", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width min
xpath: for $m in (//tei:extent[not(ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:layout)] | //tei:layout) return normalize-space(string-join(for $dim in ($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]]|$m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]/(tei:width/@min|tei:width[@quantity]/@quantity|tei:width[not(@quantity)])[last()] return if (not(number($dim) = number($dim))) then string($dim) else if ($dim/ancestor::tei:dimensions/@unit = 'in') then round(number($dim) * 25.4) else string($dim), " "))
comment: The minimum width of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a roll, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "roll", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no minimum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: unit
xpath: for $m in (//tei:extent[not(ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:layout)]|//tei:layout) return normalize-space(string-join(for $dims in ($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]]|$m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"] return let $val := ($dims/(tei:height | tei:width)/@max | $dims/(tei:height | tei:width)[@quantity]/@quantity | $dims/(tei:height | tei:width)[not(@quantity)])[last()] return if (not(number($val) = number($val))) then $dims/@unit else if ($dims/@unit = 'in') then 'mm' else $dims/@unit, " "))
comment: The unit of the roll measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "roll", within either the support or layout description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: converted
xpath: for $m in (//tei:extent[not(ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:layout)]|//tei:layout) return normalize-space(string-join(for $dims in ($m[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]]|$m/ancestor::tei:physDesc//tei:extent[.//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"]])[1]//tei:dimensions[@type="roll"] return let $val := ($dims/(tei:height | tei:width)/@max | $dims/(tei:height | tei:width)[@quantity]/@quantity | $dims/(tei:height | tei:width)[not(@quantity)])[last()] return if (not(number($val) = number($val))) then 'false' else if ($dims/@unit = 'in') then 'true' else 'false', " "))
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the maximum/minimum measurements in the preceding section have been converted from inches to millimetres. If the value is 'true', treat any measurements with caution as the conversion may mask rounding of the original value.

heading: height
comment: The height of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a fragment, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "fragment", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: height max
comment: The maximum height of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a fragment, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "fragment", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: height min
comment: The minimum height of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a fragment, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "fragment", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no minimum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width
comment: The width of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a fragment, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "fragment", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

comment: The maximum width of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a fragment, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "fragment", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. heading: width min
comment: The minimum width of the manuscript or manuscript part if it is a fragment, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "fragment", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no minimum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: unit
comment: The unit of the fragment measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "fragment", within either the support or layout description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: height
comment: The height of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: height max
comment: The maximum height of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: height min
comment: The minimum height of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width
comment: The width of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width max
comment: The maximum width of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width min
comment: The minimum width of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no minimum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: depth
comment: The depth of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the depth element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: depth max
comment: The maximum depth of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the depth element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: depth min
comment: The minimum depth of the leaves of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the depth element within a dimensions element with @type "leaf", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no minimum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: unit
comment: The unit of the leaf measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "leaf", within either the support or layout description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: n
comment: A count of the number of columns within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, encoded within the @columns attribute to a layout element within the layout description. This field may contain multiple values when the number of columns is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: n max
comment: The maximum number of columns within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, computed from the values encoded within the @columns attribute to a layout element within the layout description. This value is numeric.

heading: n min
comment: The minimum number of columns within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, computed from the values encoded within the @columns attribute to a layout element within the layout description. This value is numeric.

heading: height
comment: The height of the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: height max
comment: The maximum height of the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: height min
comment: The minimum height of the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width
comment: The width of the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width max
comment: The maximum width of the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width min
comment: The minimum width of the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "column", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: unit
comment: The unit of the column measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "column", within either the support or layout description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: width
comment: The intercolumn width for the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "intercolumn", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width max
comment: The maximum intercolumn width of the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "intercolumn", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width min
comment: The minimum intercolumn width of the columns of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "intercolumn", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: unit
comment: The unit of the intercolumncolumn measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "intercolumn", within either the support or layout description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: n
comment: A count of the number of written lines per column within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, encoded within the @writtenLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description. This field may contain multiple values when the number of lines per column is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: n max
comment: An integer value for the maximum number of written lines per column within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, calculated from information encoded within the @writtenLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description.

heading: n min
comment: An integer value for the minimum number of written lines per column within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, calculated from information encoded within the @writtenLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description.

heading: height
comment: The height of the written area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: height max
comment: The maximum height of the written area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width
comment: The width of the written area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width max
comment: The maximum width of the written area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width min
comment: The minimum width of the written area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "written", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: unit
comment: The unit of the written area measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "written", within either the support or layout description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: n
comment: A count of the number of ruled lines per column within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, encoded within the @ruledLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description. This field may contain multiple values when the number of lines per column is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: n max
comment: An integer value for the maximum number of ruled lines per column within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, calculated from information encoded within the @ruledLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description.

heading: n min
comment: An integer value for the minimum number of ruled lines per column within this section of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, calculated from information encoded within the @ruledLines attribute to a layout element within the layout description.

heading: height
comment: The height of the ruled area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: height max
comment: The maximum height of the ruled area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: height min
comment: The minimum height of the ruled area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width
comment: The width of the ruled area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric, and may be formatted as a range. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width max
comment: The maximum width of the ruled area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: width min
comment: The minimum width of the ruled area of this section of the manuscript or manuscript part, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "ruled", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm. This field may contain multiple values when the layout is variable, with sections of distinct practice separated by a space.

heading: unit
comment: The unit of the ruled area measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "ruled", within either the support or layout description. Common values are mm and in.

heading: medium
comment: Details of the medium or media of the ruling in the manuscript or manuscript part contained within the @rulingMedium attribute to a layout element within the layout description. Common values include ink, leadpoint, hardpoint, crayon, mixed, and board. Multiple values are possible, either within the same section or across different sections of practice, and are separated by a space.

heading: top line
comment: Details of whether the written text in the manuscript or manuscript part begins above or below the top line of the ruling, as contained within the @topLine attribute to a layout element within the layout description. The values are usually either above or below. Multiple values are possible, either within the same section or across different sections of practice, and are separated by a space.
